thread.title: Steve Parish gives Crystal Palace players dressing down after humiliating Sunderland defeat
thread.title_full: Steve Parish gives Crystal Palace players dressing down after humiliating Sunderland defeat

author: Jason Burt
title: Steve Parish gives Crystal Palace players dressing down after humiliating Sunderland defeat
text:
Steve Parish gives Crystal Palace players dressing down after humiliating Sunderland defeat Parish visited the dressing room after the 4-0 Selhurst Park loss Credit: PPAUK/REX/Shutterstock Jason Burt , Chief Football Correspondent 6 February 2017 • 9:30am 
C rystal Palace chairman Steve Parish laid it on the line to the club’s players after the humiliating 4-0 home defeat to Sunderland that leaves them in the Premier League relegation zone. 
Parish is understood to have taken the unusual step of going into the dressing room after Saturday’s match to tell the players how much a dire performance like that hurts the club’s supporters. 
His dramatic intervention occurred with the backing of Palace manager Sam Allardyce who also called the first-team squad into the club’s training ground at 7am on Sunday morning to go over the humiliating loss. 
Allardyce left the players in no uncertain terms of the battle they now face to avoid the drop but also that he expects an immediate reaction in next Saturday’s fixture away to Stoke City. Palace can be expected to take a ruthless ‘back to basics’ approach with Allardyce adopting a hardline stance having told the players their performances were unacceptable and he has given them plenty of opportunities. Allardyce forced the players into training at 7am on Sunday morning Credit: Leicester/BPI/REX/Shutterstock 
P arish is the kind of chairman who is loath to get involved in the dressing room area but so poor was the performance that he felt moved to act in this instance in the hope that it would provoke a reaction. There is no suggestion at all of any tension between manager and chairman. 
After the game Allardyce said the team deserved to be booed after conceding all four goals by half-time against his former club who, despite the win, remain bottom of the table albeit level on points with Palace. Premier League team of the weekend 
A llardyce took over at Christmas but has so far achieved only one victory, and collected four points in seven Premier League matches and spoke of “the fear” that is now gripping the players and of his “shock” at their performance. When asked how much the defeat hurt him, Allardyce replied “deeply”. 
Allardyce’s debrief included making the players watch a video of the Sunderland match and a clear message that they cannot hope to stay in the top-flight if they continue to perform like that. 
Parish, a Palace fan, is fully supportive of his manager, and is equally frustrated at their under-performance this season especially as there has been significant investment in the squad. 
The mood was ugly at Selhurst Park with one fan arrested after invading the pitch to confront defender Damien Delaney at half-time. Delaney was substituted but Allardyce later said it had nothing to do with the altercation.
